uk.ac.ebi.gxa.index.builder
Class DefaultIndexBuilder

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ebi.gxa.index.builder.DefaultIndexBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, IndexBuilder
public class DefaultIndexBuilder
extends Object
implements IndexBuilder, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

A default implementation of IndexBuilder that constructs a SOLR index in a supplied directory. By default, this will include all genes and experiments.

Author:
Tony Burdett

startup

public void startup()
             throws IndexBuilderException
Starts up any resources required for building an index. It will initialise an ExecutorService for running index building tasks in an asynchronous, parallel manner.

Once you have started a default index builder, it will continue to run until you call shutdown() on it.

Specified by:
startup in interface IndexBuilder
Throws:
IndexBuilderException - if initialisation of this builder failed for any reason

shutdown

public void shutdown()
              throws IndexBuilderException
Shuts down any cached resources relating to multiple solr cores within the Atlas Index. You should call this whenever the application requiring index building services terminates (i.e. on webapp shutdown, or when the user exits the application).

Specified by:
shutdown in interface IndexBuilder
Throws:
IndexBuilderException - if shutting down this index builder failed for any reason

buildIndex

public void buildIndex()
Description copied from interface: IndexBuilder
Build the index. This will build the index entirely from scratch. Use this if you wish to create or recreate the index with up-to-date information from the backing database.

Note that this method is not guaranteed to be synchronous, it only guarantees that the index has started building. Implementations are free to define their own multithreaded strategies for index construction. If you wish to be notified on completion, you should register a listener to get callback events when the build completes by using IndexBuilder.buildIndex(uk.ac.ebi.gxa.index.builder.listener.IndexBuilderListener). You can also use a listener to get at any errors that may have occurred during index building.

Calling this method is equivalent to calling buildIndex(null).

Specified by:
buildIndex in interface IndexBuilder

buildIndex

public void buildIndex(IndexBuilderListener listener)
Description copied from interface: IndexBuilder
Build the index and register a listener that provides a callback on completion of the build task. This will build the index entirely from scratch. Use this if you wish to create or recreate the index with up-to-date information from the backing database.

Note that this method is not guaranteed to be synchronous, it only guarantees that the index has started building. Implementations are free to define their own multithreaded strategies for index construction.

The listener supplied will provide callbacks whenever the indexbuilder has interesting events to report.

Specified by:
buildIndex in interface IndexBuilder
Parameters:
listener - a listener that can be used to supply callbacks when building of the index completes, or when any errors occur.

registerIndexBuildEventHandler

public void registerIndexBuildEventHandler(IndexBuilderEventHandler handler)
Description copied from interface: IndexBuilder
Register index update handler. Those handlers will be called when index build starts and finishes.

Specified by:
registerIndexBuildEventHandler in interface IndexBuilder
Parameters:
handler - handler to register

unregisterIndexBuildEventHandler

public void unregisterIndexBuildEventHandler(IndexBuilderEventHandler handler)
Description copied from interface: IndexBuilder
Unregister index update handler. Handlers will not receive notifications anymore.

Specified by:

handler - handler to unregister
